ANDS-Grants.description: Maintaining and enhancing merit-based access to the national computational infrastructure facility: This project aims to ensure that Australian researchers have access to the integrated high-performance computing and data environments they need. Australia’s national computational infrastructure (NCI) is the national, high-end research computing facility, providing researchers in universities, government science agencies and industry with world-class, integrated, high-performance services. These services enable high-impact, data-intensive computational research in all fields of science and technology. This project would continue merit-based access to NCI at the current level, ensuring ongoing international competitiveness of Australian research.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Infrastructure, Equipment and Facilities - Grant ID: LE160100051

ANDS-Grants.description: The ARC Centre of Excellence for Climate System Science is a key user of the National Computational Infrastructure facility (NCI). Our research requires massive data integrated with high performance computing in an operational facility. We are severely limited in our use of NCI by fast disk capacity that is simultaneously connected to NCI long-term storage, cloud and high performance computing. We will resolve this limitation, installing 1.7 petabytes of storage, to transform the efficiency of our use of NCI. This will enable far more ambitious science to be undertaken. We will use this investment to launch our transformation from petascale to exascale problems and communicate the lessons learned to other research communities in Australia.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Infrastructure, Equipment and Facilities - Grant ID: LE150100089
